link.label: jLibrary
link.text: Working with jLibrary

group.text: jLibrary is a Open Source content management system that fits in both enterprise and personal worlds. With jLibrary you can manage your and your enterprise documents, in a very easy an efficient way.

With jLibrary you can store your PDF, DOC, SXW, and many more different documents; you can search within them; you can categorize your documents; you can export the information very easly; you can generate entire web portals with all your information and publish it in an intranet or extranet; In summary, jLibrary is a powerful Open Source alternative for your documentation management, with all the free software advantages.

link.label: jLibrary Repository
link.text: jLibrary web home page is stored on a jLibrary repository. To run this example, you must first download the jLibrary exported repository from this URL: http://jlibrary.sourceforge.net/samples/jlibrary-repository.jlib Next, press the left button to show the import dialog. Import the recently download repository. Once the repository has been imported, go to the main jLibrary interface to see and work with its content
